issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

It's dns.adguard-dns.com server

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

nip.io

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Why did `nip.io` domain get blocked? This is a legitimate service providing free DNS records. Now it resolves all subdomains to all-zero record.


Не повторяется, но это не раздражитель.
Бесплатное прослушивание музыки имеет свои ограничения, в том числе то, что перечислено в попапе выше и без этого пользователь не узнает, почему внезапно проигрывание трека остановилось.
Можешь добавить правило `music.yandex.*##.crackdown-popup` в пользовательские.

comment.body:
@BlazDT 
Honestly it's very hard to tell. I wasn't able to reproduce with DNS filtering disabled.

When I enable DNS, it may work, sometimes it doesn't. The page doesn't like frequent Ctrl+F5 refresh and photos starts to load. Then I close and reopen my browser (cleaned Cache and Cookies).
I also do ipconfig -flushdns in between.
The AdBlock screen sometimes appear. 
Adding `gfinityesports.com#%#//scriptlet("set-constant", "admrlLoaded", "true")` with DNS enabled doesn't prevent the screen for me.

issue.title: mail.google.com: app menu incorrectly blocked by annoyances filter

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuard Annoyances filter 2.1.63.9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://mail.google.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

## Description

I am using the AdGuard Annoyances filter in uBlock Origin. One of the filters is blocking the app menu on mail.google.com.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/d62f29389f5b42d95fe3a5727d96a268976f72d0/AnnoyancesFilter/Other/sections/self-promo.txt#L37

As a temporary workaround, I had to add a filter exception:
```
mail.google.com#@#header[role="banner"] > div[class^="gb_"] > div[class^="gb_"][data-ogsr-up] > div[style^="overflow: hidden; position: absolute; top: 0px; width: 370px; z-index:"]
```

## Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1: Blocked element</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/1824428/8401e4a6-d6ef-4f43-93f7-cc04e15f5a87)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2: Filter highlighted in uBlock Origin logger</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/1824428/e7b17d7d-8083-4d28-af08-cab928960b15)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

@a-tinsmith Ok, moved to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/ContentBlocker/issues/328
But I recommend to use `AdGuard for Android` instead on content-blocker (in this case AdGuard genereates filters for content-blocker API of a browser, and we can't controll how it works).

issue.title: Planet Rock
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Planet Rock application keeps luanching a popup asking you to rate the app but however many stars you give it you cannot submit it. If you click not now it goes awayfor a few seconds then pops up again. I have been reporting this to them as a bug since January they have released 3 new versions of the app not one as fixed it.

### Proposed solution

Can Adgaurd block this application pop up I have tried enabling popup blockers but I think they are just for websites

### Additional information

I an running OSX Ventura 13.4 on a M1 iMac the Planet Rock app version is now 9.21.3(3937)

issue.body:
### ATTENTION

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you're using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you're using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: mail.google.com: app menu incorrectly blocked by annoyances filter

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuard Annoyances filter 2.1.63.9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://mail.google.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

## Description

I am using the AdGuard Annoyances filter in uBlock Origin. One of the filters is blocking the app menu on mail.google.com.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/d62f29389f5b42d95fe3a5727d96a268976f72d0/AnnoyancesFilter/Other/sections/self-promo.txt#L37

As a temporary workaround, I had to add a filter exception:
```
mail.google.com#@#header[role="banner"] > div[class^="gb_"] > div[class^="gb_"][data-ogsr-up] > div[style^="overflow: hidden; position: absolute; top: 0px; width: 370px; z-index:"]
```

## Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1: Blocked element</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/1824428/8401e4a6-d6ef-4f43-93f7-cc04e15f5a87)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2: Filter highlighted in uBlock Origin logger</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/1824428/e7b17d7d-8083-4d28-af08-cab928960b15)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Cannot reproduce with my Google accounts (AdGuard enterprise and personal one ).
@AdguardTeam/filters-maintainers Please take a look.
